title: Required Data
name: required
text: Please confirm which data you are contributing towards the IMBIE gravimetry experiment group.

elements.name: time-series-sheets
elements.label: 1a. Time-series of mass change, mass change uncertainty, and of observed area, computed including corrections for GIA, including Degree 1 contribution, including C20 contribution, and including corrections for leakage.
elements.helper: please select the areas covered by the mass change time-series data you are uploading.

options.label: Antarctic Ice Sheet (if you provide estimates over all its sub-ice sheets, please also provide the total over the Antarctic Ice Sheet).

elements.name: time-series-excludes-caps
elements.label: 1b. The IMBIE assessment should cover the ice sheets only and exclude their ice caps and peripheral glaciers. Have you made specific efforts to exclude those, apart from using the drainage basins outlines provided?

elements.name: time-series-upload
elements.label: 1c. Upload a single, concatenated, time-series data file, following the IMBIE standard file format. Please do not apply any temporal smoothing to your data, apart other than that required as part as your basic retrieval. If you provide time-series over all the basins that make up an ice sheet, please also provide the total mass change for the corresponding ice sheet.

elements.name: mass-rate-sheets
elements.label: 2a. Rates of mass change and their uncertainties, and the observed areas and time intervals over which these are calculated, computed including corrections for GIA, including Degree 1 contribution, including C20 contribution, and including corrections for leakage. Please provide discrete rates of mass change (no overlapping time intervals) at the finest temporal resolution afforded by your dataset, preferably over annual epochs or finer temporal duration. If you submit annual rates of mass change, please provide summer-centred rates.

options.label: Antarctic Ice Sheet (if you provide estimates over all its sub-ice sheets, please also provide the total over the Antarctic Ice Sheet).

elements.name: mass-rate-excludes-caps
elements.label: 2b. The IMBIE assessment should cover the ice sheets only and exclude their ice caps and peripheral glaciers. Have you made specific efforts to exclude those, apart from using the drainage basins outlines provided?

elements.name: mass-rate-upload
elements.label: 2c. Upload a single, concatenated, rate of mass change data file, following the IMBIE standard file format. Please do not apply any temporal smoothing to your data, apart other than that required as part as your basic retrieval. If you provide rates of mass change over all the basins that make up an ice sheet, please also provide the rates of total mass change for the corresponding ice sheet.

title: Supporting Information
name: supporting
text: Please answer the following questions in relation to the data you are submitting to the IMBIE gravimetry experiment group.

elements.name: missions
elements.label: 3. What missions(s) have you employed in your gravimetry mass balance calculation?

elements.name: continuity-methods
elements.label: 4. If your submission includes data from both GRACE and GRACE-FO, what methods have you employed to ensure the continuity between the two missionsâ€™ time-series, if any?

elements.name: general-methods
elements.label: 5. Which general method(s) have you employed to compute gravimetry mass balance?

elements.name: independent-observations
elements.label: 6. Which independent observations have you used to evaluate your gravimetry data set?

elements.name: gia-models
elements.label: 7. Which model(s) have you employed to account for glacial isostatic adjustment in your mass balance calculation?

elements.name: hydrology-leakage-models
elements.label: 8. Which model(s) have you employed to account for hydrology leakage in your mass balance calculation?

elements.name: ocean-leakage-models
elements.label: 9. Which model(s) have you employed to account for ocean leakage in your mass balance calculation?

elements.name: additional-leakage
elements.label: 10. Which additional source(s) of leakage have you accounted for in your mass balance calculation?

elements.name: degree-1-coefficients
elements.label: 11. Which degree 1 coefficients did you employ in your mass balance calculation?

elements.name: c20-coefficient
elements.label: 12. Which C20 coefficient did you employ in your mass balance calculation?

elements.name: methods-and-errors
elements.label: 13. Please provide the doi of a peer-reviewed article describing your methods and errors in full. In case your methods have not been published yet, please upload a document describing those for the IMBIE Executive Committee to review. (If you wish to upload multiple files, please upload them as a single .zip file)
